physicalDescription.note: On envelope: "#1091 JCRS Postcards of Campus c. 1902". On back of photograph: "Our dining room." On front of photograph: "Dining Hall J.C.R.S."

mods.abstract: Dining Hall building at JCRS. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. The sanatorium was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver.
mods.note: Photograph was donated by Sarah Holcolm Florida.
